content.description: Similar to Undying Scarab but uses the rails on the face of the right arete to work your way into a couple easy compression moves leading up and out of the cave into the topout at the face where you walk up to the entrance.
content.location: Located at the bottom right of the cave starting in a squat on the large rail with a deep incut in the back of it. Work your way up and out of the cave similar to Undying Scarab.  There is potential for a sit start to this problem.

content.description: A super fun arete problem similar to, but easier than Amun.  Work your way up the right arete up out of the cave and topout on some jugs on the face you see walking up to the cave entrance.
content.location: Located deep in the right side of the cave.  Start on the low part of the right arete and follow the arete up through the topout using your foot jams and some hand jams if you desire to work your way up and out of the cave.

content.description: Just outside the entrance to King Tut’s Tomb is the 3-tiered rock formation.  This problem is simple yet deceiving, requiring you to take your time to get the send.
content.location: Start on bottom tier on a good hold on the middle right portion with a high left foot.  Rock yourself up into the next tier and work a couple techy moves as you slightly traverse left into the same finish as  Undying Scarab and Young Pharaoh

content.description: Super fun mix problem starting deep into the right side of the cave.  Work your way up the arete using a mix of hand/feet jams, sloppy dishes, and crimps all the way through the apex of the cave.
content.location: Starts deep into the right side of the cave. Start right hand on a 3 finger undercling and left on the sloping rail right next to it.  Rides the entire left arete up through the topout. All rock other than the left arete is off except for some fun camming and jamming for your hands and feet requiring you to cam on the right face

content.description: A really cool tight cave located up on top of and behind the  Pyramid Boulder.  Offers some really fun problems including overhung hand jams, aretes, and foot cams. If you have the pads and a spotter available this is definitely a worthwhile place to go.
